wikipedia_page.main: Jack Baird (born 7 February 1996) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a defender for Ayr United.

response: In the 2010s the club drew praise for their youth development, bringing through several players from their academy (despite it not being listed among the 'elite' group assessed by the SFA in 2017) including Stevie Mallan, Jack Baird, Kyle Magennis, Jason Naismith, Kyle McAllister, Sean Kelly and full Scotland internationals Kenny McLean, Lewis Morgan and John McGinn.Scottish clubs urged to keep faith with youth by former St Mirren academy boss. BBC Sport, 14 January 2018.Youth Academy: Hall of Fame. St Mirren FC.

On 14 May the club announced that youngsters Jack Baird, Lewis Morgan and Barry Cuddihy had all signed contract extensions to their current deals. Baird and Morgan have signed two–year extensions, while Cuddihy signed a one–year extension with the option of another year after that.
11 May – young defender Jack Baird signed a one-year contract extension with the club.
1 February – defender Jack Baird signed a one-year extension to his current contract, keeping his at Saints until the summer of 2019.
* 1 February – defender Jack Baird signed a two-year contract extension, keeping him tied to the club until 2021.

On 2 September, defender Jack Baird signed for rivals Greenock Morton on a short-term loan. On 3 September, former Saint Kirk Broadfoot signed a two-year contract with the club, after being released by Kilmarnock.

On 7 January, Saints signed Irish duo Jamie McGrath and Conor McCarthy on two-and-a-half year deals. Midfielder McGrath signed from Dundalk, and defender McCarthy moves from Cork City. Also on this day, defender Jack Baird extended his loan at Greenock Morton until the end of the season. On 8 January, defender Akin Famewo signed on loan until the end of the season from Norwich City.
